data.title: First Time Visit
data.text:
We made our first visit to Bull City Burger and Brewery on a recent trip to Durham.  We wanted to grab a quick bite to eat and this place was great!  Located downtown, in an area that is going through a renaissance of sorts.  Parking was easy to locate (we visited after they stopped charging for parking), and the walk to the restaurant wasn’t bad.

The menu was simple to navigate, ample selection of beers brewed in their brewery.  Food was hot and delicious.  Farm-raised beef and fresh local ingredients.  Friendly staff and atmosphere.  Don’t think I’d put his on my Top 10 “Gotta Go There Again” places, but we would go back for sure.

data.title: An Afternoon in Durham
data.text: This is a great little place in downtown Durham-lots of brews of their own and fell-brewers' making, with a good selection of burgers and other local foods

data.title: Good food. Friendly service
data.text: Stopped in for a meal on Friday night. We were in town for a Saturday wedding and we're looking for somewhere local to get a burger and a beer. Having never been here before we didn't really know what to expect or even how the ordering process worked. The friendly cashier came out from behind the register and took us to where we could find a menu. She then proceed to give us details and recommendations which really helped. The food was fresh and delicious. Quite a few beer choices too which didn't disappoint. Thanks for a good meal and some friendly local service to make us out of towners feel welcome.

data.title: Great burger...cool atmosphere!
data.text: The place was packed and full of energy!  We went with high expectations and they didn't disappoint..  We had the kale/cheese dip app...banging!...the pimento burger...bacon/fried egg burger....all the burgers were great...order with a little pink...cooked perfect!  Couple of signature cocktails...and a black cherry soda....you will not be disappointed..... the noise and parking were the only negatives!  We will do this again!

data.title: Great Food
data.text: We visited for lunch and it was not disappointing. I had the hotdog and my wife had a burger.  We split the fries.  We agreed we would eat here again. Their craft beer was very good also.  Small place but worth it. They make every thing in house.  Try there BBQ sauce.

data.title: Easy atmosphere, great brew and food.
data.text: Easy and reasonable with high quality food. Service is quick and the atmosphere is fun. Great brew experience too.

data.title: Really Good Burger, Kinda Expensive
data.text: My husband and I ate here on a Saturday night.  While waiting in line, an employee was walking up and down the line handing out menus and describing the food, which felt friendly and helpful.  I ordered the bleu cheese burger and truffles fries.  They were both delicious!  The wait in line/find a seat/noisy atmosphere was not my favorite and I thought the prices were high.  But, if you're looking for a bustling place with that Durham, college town vibe, you'll love this place.

data.title: Favorite burguers in town
data.text: Just the perfect place for meat lovers looking for a tasty hamburger resembling the flavors you get when you preparing them at home but including premium top quality ingredients and eating a bowl of award winning beef chili as a side dish. They also have a variety of artisan beers that could match any hamburger you choose.

data.title: Fantastic Burgers and Beer
data.text:
The burgers are very good with a lot of variety. Everything is locally sourced and fresh, so it is a little on the pricey side, but definitely worth it. The fried pickles are very good as an appetizer. The have a good selection of quality craft brews. 

You order at the counter and a server brings your food to you at your table. Service was pretty fast. Definitely a fantastic burger place.

data.title: EVERY menu item we tried here was a flavorful slap to the head!
data.text: Great burgers.  I had a burger cooked "a little pink" (they have three levels of done: rare, little pink and well) with caramelized onions, cheddar, lettuce, and tomato that was scrumptious.  You can really tell that this is a pastured beef..SO flavorful.  Also had a hot dog that was incredible with their homemade beer brown mustard and onions and, with their awesome toasted homemade bun, it was also out of this world delicious.  And, yes, I too (like other reviewers) wish the duck frit fries were thicker, but DANG they were awesome. Flavor BOMB level of goodness.  British IPA beer was a little too un-hoppy for me, but it WAS good, nonetheless.  And my daughter had the homemade vanilla ice cream - yeah, you gotta try that.  Tons of flavor there, as well. So yeah, two thumbs up...this is a must visit if you're in the bull city, for SURE!

data.title: Bull City Burger and Brewery Excellent Place to Eat!!
data.text: Would highly recommend Bull City Burger and Brewery. Excellent burgers and soups. Good selection of Beers!!

data.title: Really Good Food and the Best Beer Tour
data.text: I have been to Bull City Burger multiple times, and I have never been disappointed with the food. It is more than I generally like to spend on a burger, but everything is fresh, local, and made in house, so the price is justified. The absolute best value is the Saturday afternoon beer tour. $5 for the tour, a good beer buzz, and credit towards a growler purchase. My favorite thing about BCBB is the Golden Bull Scavenger Hunt during the month of March. I always have a lot of fun, and have learned a lot about Durham participating.

data.title: Quite tasty
data.text: Great little place for burgers and brews. My husband really does not care for ground beef because of its side effects (heartburn, fatty, settles badly) but because theirs is all grass fed even he enjoyed our visit. Beer was really good. I didn't realize until we were actually inside that you order at a counter and it's brought to you (vs a traditional sit-down place) but the food was fast and delicious and the staff were super attentive. We head to that area regularly and will definitely be back!

data.title: Perfect if you have Jury Duty :)
data.text:
Location, location, location, and this place has it if you happen have jury selection duty. Right around the corner from the courthouse and it's the only non fast food in the immediate area. 
Just what you need after a stressful morning of court. Sit back and relax with your favorite libation or try one of their own brews. The burgers are big and juicy with every topping you could want and some you might not have thought of. Be sure to buy a jar of their peanuts, they are good snack for the rest of the afternoon. They also sell dog treats made from the brew mash.

data.title: Good Burgers
data.text: Mainly Burgers and hot dogs. Long lines but food is good. Close to DPAC which is why we went there. You order in line and food comes. No sauce at table. They chase tables the service hunts for numbers. In spite of this the place is busy.

data.title: Beer Tour
data.text: Went on a beer tour today at 11:30. It was exceptionally fine and had a great time. The tour guide was very helpful, fun and very knowledgeable about the breweries we visited. We had approximately 20 people in the tour, the beers were good, staff at the breweries were knowledgeable and informative. Cannot say I was a fan of all the beers but some of the beers were outstanding others, where in the eye of the beholder. We visited, bull-city breweries, The dirty-bull brewery, and full-sail brewery.  Ended up back at bull city brewery, we had lunch in the food and staff again is absolutely great. It was absolutely a beautiful warm day in the bull city.

data.title: Tasty burgers and root beer!
data.text: Very fast service, and delicious local sodas.  The burgers are unique and juicy, and the fries are delicious.  Will definitely be back when craving a burger!

data.title: Good hamburger
data.text: The setting is quite nice in downtown Durham. Seatings are quite essential but this is not a fine dining place: good hamburgers and beer. And that is what you will get not much more!

data.title: Best Burger and Brew in town
data.text: Beers is cold and novel. Burgers bursting with flavor. Great condiments. Don't miss the duck fries. Beautifully seasoned. Hip crowd and destination for all city dwellers.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Excellent burgers! Great atmosphere ! Fast server crashes and family friendly!Highly recommend the pimento cheese burger!
